remarks.p: Initial publication.
Updated for annual assessment.

role.title: Prepared By
role.desc: The organization that prepared this SSP. If developed in-house, this is the CSP itself.

role.title: Prepared For
role.desc: The organization for which this SSP was prepared. Typically the CSP.

role.title: System Security Plan Approval
role.desc: The individual or individuals accountable for the accuracy of this SSP.

role.title: Information System Owner
role.desc: The individual within the CSP who is ultimately accountable for everything related to this system.

role.title: Authorizing Official
role.desc: The individual or individuals who must grant this system an authorization to operate.

role.title: Authorizing Official's Point of Contact
role.desc: The individual representing the authorizing official.

role.title: Information System Management Point of Contact (POC)
role.desc: The highest level manager who responsible for system operation on behalf of the System Owner.

role.title: Information System Technical Point of Contact
role.desc: The individual or individuals leading the technical operation of the system.

role.title: General Point of Contact (POC)
role.desc: A general point of contact for the system, designated by the system owner.

role.title: System Information System Security Officer (or Equivalent)
role.desc: The individual accountable for the security posture of the system on behalf of the system owner.

role.title: Privacy Official's Point of Contact
role.desc: The individual responsible for the privacy threshold analysis and if necessary the privacy impact assessment.

role.title: Owner of an inventory item within the system.
Administrative responsibility an inventory item within the system.
ICA POC (Local)
role.desc: The point of contact for an interconnection on behalf of this system.

remarks.p: Remove this role if there are no ICAs.

role.title: ICA POC (Remote)
role.desc: The point of contact for an interconnection on behalf of this external system to which this system connects.

remarks.p: Remove this role if there are no ICAs.

role.title: ICA Signatory (Local)
role.desc: Responsible for signing an interconnection security agreement on behalf of this system.

remarks.p: Remove this role if there are no ICAs.

role.title: ICA Signatory (Remote)
role.desc: Responsible for signing an interconnection security agreement on behalf of the external system to which this system connects.

remarks.p: Remove this role if there are no ICAs.

role.title: Consultant
role.desc: Any consultants involved with developing or maintaining this content.

role.title: Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program (FedRAMP)

remarks.p: The CSP's HQ, or the address of the system owner's primary business location.
For a primary or alternate data center, briefly summarize the components at this location.
For a primary or alternate data center, briefly summarize the components at this location.
Replace sample CSP information.

org.org-name: Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program: Program Management Office
Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program: Joint Authorization Board

remarks.p: Generic placeholder for any external organization
Underlying service provider. Leveraged Authorization.
This OSCAL-based FedRAMP SSP Template can be used for the FedRAMP Low, Moderate, and High baselines.
A template for FedRAMP Tailored, Appendix B requires syntax that has not yet been developed.

description.p: Describe the purpose and functions of this system here.

remarks.p: Remarks are required if service model is "other". Optional otherwise.
Remarks are required if deployment model is "hybrid-cloud" or "other". Optional otherwise.

adjustment-justification.p: Required if the base and selected values do not match.
Required if the base and selected values do not match.
Required if the base and selected values do not match.

remarks.p: Remarks are required if status/state is "other". Optional otherwise.
Notes about this system
Overall notes about the inheritance of controls from this system

description.p: A holistic, top-level explanation of the FedRAMP authorization boundary.
A holistic, top-level explanation of the network architecture.
A holistic, top-level explanation of the system's data flows.

authorized-privilege.title: Portal administration
authorized-privilege.function-performed: Create, modify and delete client applications

authorized-privilege.title: Administrative Access Approver
authorized-privilege.function-performed: Approves access requests for administrative accounts.

authorized-privilege.title: Access Approver
authorized-privilege.function-performed: Approves access requests for administrative accounts.

description.p: The entire system as depicted in the system authorization boundary
A FedRAMP-authorized system, from which this system inherits controls.

remarks.p: COMMENTS: Provide other comments as needed.
COMMENTS: Provide other comments as needed.
Vendor appliance. No admin-level access.

service.title: ServiceName
service.purpose: Describe the purpose of this service

remarks.p: If "other", remarks are required. Optional otherwise.
Optional notes about this interconnection
If no, explain why. If yes, omit remarks field.
If no, explain why. If yes, omit remarks field.
Optional, longer, formatted description.
COMMENTS: Additional information about this item.
If no, explain why. If yes, omit remark.
If no, explain why. If yes, omit remark.
COMMENTS: If needed, provide additional information about this inventory item.
Asset wasn't running at time of scan.
Asset wasn't running at time of scan.

description.p: This description field is required by OSCAL. FedRAMP does not require any specific information here.

remarks.p: Describe the plan to complete the implementation.

description.p: Describe how Part a is satisfied.
